alert.note: Alert for Lee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:56AM CDT until April 05 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR EASTERN LEE COUNTY... At 556 AM CDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located near Sublette, or near Amboy, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Lee County, including the following locations... West Brooklyn, Lee Center and Steward. This includes... Lee County Fairgrounds. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 88 and 96. I-88 between mile markers 66 and 74. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
